tit.cmt: 用語集では、「福王流」はHukuo-ryu、人名の「福王」はFUKUOになっています。統一されてませんが、用語集に合わせ、そのままにしました。
「～流」→school として統一しました。Fukuo としました。

sen.j: 福王流（ふくおう-りゅう）は能楽ワキ方の一流派。
sen.e: Hukuo-ryu is a school of waki-kata (supporting actors).
The Fukuo school is a school of waki-kata (supporting actors) in Nohgaku (the art of Noh).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代には主に観世流の座付として活動し、現在でも芸系が近い。
sen.e: In the Edo period, this school acted as Zatsuki (working in the theater) for Kanze school and even now, the entertainment system is close to Kanze school.
sen.cmt: 観世流、座付、芸系は、用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: In the Edo period, this school performed exclusively for Kanze school and even now, the performance style is close to that of Kanze school.

sen.j: 初世福王但馬守盛忠（1521年～1606年）は播磨国三木の神官であったが、観世座の脇の棟梁観世元頼（観世長俊の子）に師事した。
sen.e: Tajima no Kami Moritada FUKUO, the first (1521-1606) was a Shinto priest in Miki, Harima Province, but he studied under Motoyori KANZE (son of Nagatoshi KANZE), waki no toryo (secondary actor) in Kanze-za.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)末期から安土桃山時代にかけては、それまで座の第二位の役者が担当し、特にシテ方と区別されることのなかったワキの役（通常これを後世のワキ方と区別して「脇のシテ」「脇の棟梁」などと呼ぶ）が、徐々に独自の職掌としてシテ方から区分されるようになってきていた時期であった。
sen.e: From the end of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) to the Azuchi-Momoyama period, waki (supporting actors), which had been played by the secondary actor in the troupe and had not been differentiated from shite-kata (main roles), (usually, this was called as "waki no shite" or "waki no toryo" to be distinguished from later waki-kata), was gradually differentiated from shite-kata (main roles) as own official duties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処戦国時代 (日本)は、the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan)としました。
sen.e: From the end of the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan) to the Azuchi-Momoyama period, waki (supporting actors), which had until then been played by the secondary actor in the troupe and had not been differentiated from shite-kata (main roles) (usually, this was called as 'waki no shite' or 'waki no toryo' to be distinguished from the later waki-kata), was gradually differentiated from shite-kata as own official duties.
sen.cmt: period を小文字にしました。"→ ' に変更しました。
sen.e: From the end of the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan) to the Azuchi-Momoyama period, waki (supporting actors), which had until then been played by the secondary actor in the troupe and had not been differentiated from shite-kata (main roles) (usually, this was called as 'waki no shite' or 'waki no toryo' to be distinguished from the later waki-kata), was gradually differentiated from shite-kata as own official duties.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 初世以後、福王家は観世座のワキとして活躍していたが、四世盛厚の代に後嗣を欠いて中絶した。
sen.e: Since the first, the Fukuo family had been active as waki in Kanze-za, but lost koshi (successor) in the period of Moriatsu, the fourth.

sen.j: これを惜しんだ観世黒雪が弟服部栖元の子を五世福王盛親として福王家を再興せしめた。
sen.e: Kokusetsu KANZE felt sorry about the discontinuance of the family and rebuilt the Fukuo family by making the child of 服部栖元 as Morichika FUKUO, the fifth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処服部栖元は、用語集で読み方不明でしたので、そのまま使用しました。
sen.e: Kokusetsu KANZE felt sorry about the discontinuance of the family and rebuilt the Fukuo family by making the child of Seigen HATTORI (服部栖元), who was his younger brother, as Morichika FUKUO the fifth.
sen.cmt: 服部栖元→Seigen HATTORI と読むのではないかと推測しましたが、確かではないため、漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: Kokusetsu KANZE felt sorry about the discontinuance of the family and rebuilt the Fukuo family by making the child of Seigen HATTORI (服部栖元), who was his younger brother, as Morichika FUKUO the fifth.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 盛親は隠居後、京都に移住して服部宗巴と号し、素謡教授を専らとした。
sen.e: After Morichika retired, he moved to Kyoto and called himself Soha HATTORI and became a teacher of su-utai (Noh lyrics without music). (At that time, waki also acted as jigashira (the leader of the group reciters), so both waki-kata and shite-kata often played a part of jiutai (Noh chorus). Therefore, shite-kata and waki-kata also existed among su-utai teachers and especially, waki-kata were influential in Kyoto.)

sen.j: そのため、同地において福王流は大きな勢力を占めるようになったが、後嗣六世盛信は狷介な人柄で信望がなく、諍いから門弟を多く破門した。
sen.e: Hukuo-ryu extend its power in Kyoto, but koshi Morinobu, the sixth was a stubborn person and he lacked of prestige, so he excommunicated many disciples because of conflicts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, Fukuo school extended its power in Kyoto, but the successor, Morinobu the sixth was a stubborn person with little popularity, and excommunicated many disciples because of conflicts.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Accordingly, Fukuo school extended its power in Kyoto, but the successor, Morinobu the sixth was a stubborn person with little popularity, and excommunicated many disciples because of conflicts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、京都における有力な弟子家である京都五軒家（岩井・井上・林・薗・浅野）が揃って観世流に転じるという事件を引き起こした。
sen.e: Therefore, it caused the incident that Kyo Kanze Gokenya (The Five Kanze Families in Kyoto) (Iwai, Inoue, Hayashi, Sono, Asano), which were powerful disciple families in Kyoto, transferred to Kanze school all together.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 八世福王盛有は文筆に優れ、謡曲を新作するほか「江戸洪水記」などをあらわした。
sen.e: Moriari FUKUO, the eighth excelled in literary work and composed a new piece of Yokyoku, and wrote 'Edo kozuiki' (a document about a flood in the Edo period.)
Moriari FUKUO the eighth excelled in literary work; he not only composed new pieces of Yokyoku, but also wrote 'Edo kozuiki' (a document about a flood in the Edo period).

sen.e: His child, Morikatsu, the ninth inherited his father's literatures' hobby and learned painting from Itcho HANABUSA, so he is well-known as Gago (pseudonym), Sesshin FUKUO.

sen.j: 維新後、1898年に十四世福王繁十郎盛哲が没して宗家が一時中絶するものの、遺弟の野島信（東京）、中村弥三郎（大阪）らが芸系を守った。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, 福王繁十郎盛哲, the fourteenth died in 1898 and the Soke was temporarily discontinued, but bereaved disciples, Makoto NOJIMA (Tokyo), Yasaburo NAKAMURA (Osaka) and others kept the entertainment system.
